elements.title: Chesmac (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that as the 1979 computer chess game Chesmac (pictured) could not display a chessboard on screen, players had to replicate the game on a physical chessboard?

elements.title: Piano Sonata (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Samuel Barber said that he could not adequately play his own Piano Sonata?

elements.title: Michael Chisholm (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that geographer Michael Chisholm and contemporaries became known as "Caesar's Praetorian Guard", in reference to their teacher Gus Caesar?

elements.title: Des Moines speech (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Anne Morrow Lindbergh tried to warn her husband Charles Lindbergh of the backlash that his antisemitic Des Moines speech would receive?

elements.title: Rose Betts (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Rose Betts wrote the song "Driving Myself Home" as a joke after a blind date, only for it to go viral on TikTok?

elements.title: Rooms by the Sea (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that an art critic felt that Rooms by the Sea was one of Edward Hopper's "strangest" works?

elements.title: Beata Olsson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that when Swedish soccer player Beata Olsson transferred from Florida to Florida State, she said that she did not really know about the schools' rivalry?

elements.title: a library in memory of his mother (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that John Passmore Edwards erected a library in memory of his mother?

elements.title: Hymenophyllum axsmithii (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that researchers want Hymenophyllum axsmithii rhizomes so that they can tell whether the filmy fern was up a tree?
